result.execSummary:
The defendant Bruce J Stueber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $243 to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  $200 DNA surcharge remitted.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bruce J Stueber

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  Judgment of conviction prepared.
Defendant in court with Attorney John k Smerlinski.  Chelsea E Wetjen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Set for plea/sentencing
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
with Authorization: Atty John K Smerlinski for Defn
and Notice of DNA and Witness List (Plaintiff's)
Final pre-trial on February 20, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence against Lisa S.
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 1:00 PM today.  If the defendant fails to comply with Dane County Bail Monitoring, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $1500.00 per case, as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. If Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM. If Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public.The Defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. Defendant is ordered to cooperate with DCBM.
Trial Judge - Br 1

Defendant appeared.  Kristin K. Shimabuku appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
